intro: Sidalcea sparsifolia, commonly known as the sparseleaf checkermallow, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes mallows and hibiscus. The plant is characterized by its slender, branched stems and showy, pink to purple flowers that bloom in summer. Its leaves are narrow and spaced apart, giving it a sparsely foliaged appearance. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in open habitats such as grasslands and rocky areas.
